instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..

threads.title: Maybe off topic. "Service Recommended" Warning on Big Sur after new battery installation.
threads.message: I have been successfully replacing batteries using "Original" Apple parts on several models of <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MacBooks. Systems that are running macOS 11 Big Sur are now reporting a "Service Recommended" warning in the menubar after installation. Booting into older OS (High Sierra, Mojave, Catalina) do not give this error. Is there any way to rectify this issue?

threads.title: Maybe off topic. "Service Recommended" Warning on Big Sur after new battery installation.
Maybe off topic. "Service Recommended" Warning on Big Sur after new battery installation.
threads.message: Did PRAM reset, SMC reset, completely drain and then charge to full overnight, SMC reset again, PRAM reset again. No change.

threads.title: Maybe off topic. "Service Recommended" Warning on Big Sur after new battery installation.
threads.message:
Some people claim the Big Sur last version solved the bug...

threads.title: Maybe off topic. "Service Recommended" Warning on Big Sur after new battery installation.
threads.message: This system is running 11.4, which I believe is the newest version. SMC and PRAM reset apparently works with 2016/2017 MBP but this is an older L2013 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>.
